Who needs a cleric around?  Lay a teleport marker a good distance away 
from the battle.  Then wait until your mana is recharged and start 
summoning fire elementals.  The problem is a single archmage can 
summon hundreds of fire elementals.  Talk about the balance of power 
favoring an archmage.  If it wasn't for faeries being an achilles 
heal, archmages would be invincible in all situations.

Chain lightning - if implemented properly - would rock.  But chain 
lightning shouldn't be used against more than 20 opponents until it 
is revised unless you want your computer to freeze over.  I've tried 
increasing memory allocation to gladiator, shutting down as many 
programs as possible, and slowing down/speeding up the game to improve 
the performance of chain lightning.  If someone knows of any way that 
improves the performance of chain lightning, EMAIL THE GROUP.

I do invite people to go through my set and try out scenario 162.  
Why?  It's an archmage vs a cleric as long as you can keep your own 
team out of the battle for their own good.

I believe a fully powered cleric as dangerous as a fully powered 
archmage except for one thing: the cleric would rather attack than 
raise the undead.  The archmage would quickly summon fire elementals.
